fields.description:
From a customer:

The problem we are having is that once all reviewers have finished providing comments and the review is closed, we need a way to track progress against the defects found for closure. It appears to us that the best way to handle this is with the use of JIRA integrated into our Crucible projects. The author can now create JIRA  sub-tasks for each review issue, but the only hard part is that it appears he/she must do that one review comment at a time. It would be nice if we could see the entire consolidated list of review issues and select the ones to make JIRA issue for and have it do it in bulk. Or if the system could be configured so that each time a review defect was created a JIRA sub-task was automatically created.

Initially we tried to figure out a way to simply status them directly in Crucible, but that does not appear to be possible.
fields.summary: bulk create JIRA issues from Crucible

fields.description: Pariticipant lists pulled down lazily as part of the autocomplete controls? maybe profile to see if this is a problem (but surely it is for large userbases)
fields.summary: lazily load users list in Edit Details

However such URL on my local Crucible: http://localhost:8060/rest-service/reviews-v1/CR-11/details 
gives me

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<detailedReviewData>

fields.description:
I was surprised to find that there is not a standard, easy to get to (read: from the review's front page)
that can show the traditional code review output:
1) List all defects w/ type, location (file/line), and description (I imagine being able to filter by defects/all comments/those with JIRA issues) and potentially also listing the users involved in the discussion of each one.
2) Summarize review by # defects of each type, # each by severity, time spent by reviewer

It may be a related item rather than part of the report proper, but the moderator should be able to check off each defect from #1 above as verified.

Essentially, having a big blank box to summarize the review doesn't really capture what normally happens at the end of a review, at least from
the basic CMM perspective.
fields.summary: Review Summary Reports

fields.description:
My Crucible UI was running very slow, im running server, and everything on the same machine to evaluate.

So i click in a source file and scroll down too fast, the comment window popuped ouside my viewpane. So i was unable to understand how to put a comment, i tough it was bugged.

Would it be possible, that if you click in a source file while the popup is openned, to refocus/scroll back on it. Or cancel the previous one and reopen it where you just clicked. Something like that.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Comment popup window lost while scrolling.

fields.description:
If when administering a project the moderator role is disabled, the user must select a compatible permission scheme (i.e. one that does not rely solely on the moderator to complete any steps in the workflow).

If there are no compatible existing permission schemes, provide some explanatory text and a button to create a compatible scheme, which is then used for that project.
fields.summary: [Admin] need ability to create a new permission scheme to support moderator-less reviews if no compatible perm scheme exists.
Filters (for comments at least) aren't reapplied when content is reloaded in a review

fields.description:
Whilst using a review, someone else created a file-level defect. I received the notification and clicked 'reload'.

The file was marked as not read (since my settings are to uncomplete me if a defect is raised) and an unread comment count, "(1)", was added to the file. When I clicked on the file, however, the defect didn't show up.

When I loaded the whole review in another tab, the defect was visible.
fields.summary: File-level defect not inserted on live update

fields.description:
Currently, invoking Add Content dialog's causes the page to reload when the Done button is pressed.

Geoff thinks it'll be possible to make use of the poll/content update method rather than insisting on a page reload. So if you open the dialog and close it without any changes there'll be no refresh. If the change can be done with a refresh only, it'll do that. If the refresh detects that a reload is required, it'll do that too.

Should speed up the perceived responsiveness.
fields.summary: Update rather than reloading the page follow a Content Add

fields.description:
When creating a Crucible Review, uploading patches does not work using Google Chrome for Windows (version 3.0.195.33).
You can select a file, and click upload, and the page refreshes, but there's no patch present.
The exact same patch file uploads perfectly using FireFox 3 on the same client machine.
I've seen this across 4 or 5 reviews, both large and small, so it doesn't seem to be a problem with a particular patch file, path structure, etc.
fields.summary: Unable to upload patches to reviews in Chrome (on Windows); same patch uploads fine with FireFox

fields.description: The DB case sensitivity test implemented for CRUC-2814 requires that the DB schema has already been created. It would be nice to test this also in {{TestDBConnectionAjaxAction}}, but at that point the DB hasn't been created, so we would need to create a test table, or check a well-known data type for each DB type (less robust).
fields.summary: Check DB case sensitivity at connection test time

fields.description:
Original description is at https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PL-1937

Steps to reproduce using IntelliJ Connector:

    * Author creates CodeReview ticket and adds reviewers.
    * Reviewers add comments and complete review.
    * Author adds comment.
      (All users have 'receive email notifications' option checked in their profiles)

Actual result:

    * Reviewers are not notified by e-mail that author has added a comment.
    * Also if any reviewer adds a comment, other reviewers will not have notification.

Expected result:

    * When author or reviewer adds a comment all other reviewers should have notification (even if reviewer has completed review).
fields.summary: Email notifications not sent when commenting a review using REST

fields.description:
Since the introduction of moderatorless reviews, the {{toSummarize}} filters no longer work.

Review filters create monolithic HQL queries which cannot be tweaked to support the notion of moderatorless reviews when searching multiple projects.

This provides us with the opportunity to create a Review Lucene document. {{ReviewManager.getReviewsAsRolesInStates}} should be refactored to use the lucene index rather than database queries.
fields.summary: Create Lucene Review Document

fields.description: because it displays immediately on a resize, it makes the page feel slower than it is. it should only come up after a few hundred milli seconds / only come up for resizes that will take a long time, eg multi file view
fields.summary: content shield (bar spinner) in crucible should only show up after a small delay

fields.description:
By default, MySQL creates Dbs with case insensitive comparisons (although our documentation specifies that case sensitive comparisons must be used)

We don't check this, which can cause problems if a path is stored in one case and later occurs in a different case.

e.g.:

2009-12-01 20:58:33,242 ERROR [btpool0-310] org.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter org.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter-logExceptions - Duplicate entry 'FE-18870-48891' for key 2

We need to check this configuration and report it with a banner (should this be on every page or just the admin page?)
fields.summary: Crucible doesn't ensure its SQL DB is using case-sensitive comparisons

fields.description:
To reproduce:
# Visit a review, such as: [CR-FE-2800|https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2800]
# In view preferences:
#* Untick _Show Source_
#* Select _Show Above Comments_
# Enable a filter for files with comments
# Enable multi file view
fields.summary: Multi FRX doesn't respect filter

fields.description:
If a user is logged in to FishEye but does not have Crucible permissions, the user cannot create a Crucible review.

The error message given in the above situation is very misleading. It told me that I needed to be a logged-in user in order to create a Crucible review. It says
{quote}An error has occurred. You must login to add to a review.{quote}
(See attached screenshot.)
So I thought something must be wrong with my Crowd integration and went off testing SSO, looking into groups, etc. 

Instead, perhaps it should say something like:
{quote}You do not have permission to use Crucible. Please contact your system administrator.{quote}
fields.summary: Misleading error message when user does not have Crucible permission

fields.description:
When you enable Crucible on an existing FishEye installation, existing FishEye users are by default marked as not having permission to use Crucible. By default, we should mark all existing users as having Crucible permission.

See attached screenshot from [Dragons|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ATLAS/After+Dragons].
fields.summary: FishEye users should automatically get Crucible permission when adding Crucible to existing FishEye
Change MySQL table scripts to use ENGINE = InnoDB instead of type = InnoDB

When completing the review, I'm warned that I have draft comments and that I should post/delete/view them. When viewing the comments the draft comment filter is enabled but no frxs are enabled and general comments is empty.

This problem persists between page refreshes.
fields.summary: Incorrect warning about draft comments

fields.description:
it can look a bit strange if everyone has been uncompleted

eg. everyone completes. someone adds a new revision. everyone gets auto-uncompleted. history will look like:

(nothing else)

however when the author looks at the review, x, y and z are all incomplete
fields.summary: review history doesnt contain 'reviewer uncompleted' events
review history doesnt indicate if a comment is a defect

fields.description:
If you enter Crucible via a create review link from FishEye, the FRXs that will be in the review are loaded via ajax even though you can never see them till after the page is refreshed. And when the page is refreshed they get loaded via ajax once more.

As the ajax delays the loading of the content in the dialogue, disabling the ajax will make the dialogue load more quickly.
fields.summary: Stop FRX ajax when Crucible is loaded in Create mode

fields.description: On EAC r48598, the {{n}} and {{p}} work fine, but {{\[}} and {{\]}} don't.
fields.summary: Previous and next unread comment shortcuts don't work

fields.description:
The error is thrown when navigating to "People" tab:
{noformat}
2009-11-25 16:27:48,531 ERROR [btpool0-10] org.mortbay.log org.mortbay.log.Slf4jLog-warn - /users
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.crucible.activity.review.LuceneReviewCommentActivityItemProvider.hasViewPermission(LuceneReviewCommentActivityItemProvider.java:223)
	at com.atlassian.crucible.activity.review.LuceneReviewCommentActivityItemProvider.access$300(LuceneReviewCommentActivityItemProvider.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.crucible.activity.review.LuceneReviewCommentActivityItemProvider$2.perform(LuceneReviewCommentActivityItemProvider.java:188)
	at com.atlassian.crucible.activity.review.LuceneReviewCommentActivityItemProvider$2.perform(LuceneReviewCommentActivityItemProvider.java:178)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.lucene.LuceneConnection.withIndexSearcher(LuceneConnection.java:513)
{noformat}


This issue seems to be happened in version 2.1 onwards.

For example, before upgrading from 2.0.x to version 2.1.2, create a review and add a comment in version 2.1.2, it will create indexes at {{FISHEYE_HOME\cache\cruidx}}. So when you perform the upgrade by copying the {{var}} and {{config.xml}} to the new installation and restart the server should reproduce the error. It appears that it actually conflicts with the {{FISHEYE_HOME\cache\cruidx}} files.

A workaround is manually removing the {{cruidx}} directory. To do so,
# Shutdown your crucible server
# Remove the {{FISHEYE_HOME\cache\cruidx}} directory
# Restart crucible server

Or using the new installation while upgrading should eliminate the problem.
fields.summary: NPE when accessing to the people tab

fields.description: !http://content.screencast.com/users/tpettersen/folders/Jing/media/01a3a70e-5269-42d7-9a9e-1ed3db3df90b/2009-11-30_1500.png!

fields.description:
Crucible 2.0.x used to show you the number of comments per revision of a file. In 2.1 we changed it such that it will only show the total number of comments. However if you are viewing a revision that has comments that are not applicable to you you still see the total number of comments:

!http://img.skitch.com/20091126-fetj171th6d5bxdiae87wx4gqg.jpg!

Would be nice if we showed something like "1 of 3" to indicate how many relevant comments there are for the current view.
fields.summary: Show the number of relevant comments for the current diff in addition to the total for the file

fields.summary: user typeahead find should rank matches starting with the typed string higher

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Edit a Crucible review
2. Change the author and moderator to person X
3. Add person Y as a reviewer
4. Click on Done
5. Author, moderator and reviewers remain unchanged and error log shows an exception

Expected behaviour:
Requested changes are made

Error log exception:
Caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Duplicate entry '1825-1' for key 2

Workaround:
Do the changes separately, ie. click on Done after step 2, then edit the review again and re-start at step 3.
fields.summary: Simultaneously editing the author, moderator and adding a reviewer results in BatchUpdateException: Duplicate entry

fields.description: Currently the project service is read-only. A customer would like to be able to create projects using the REST API.
fields.summary: Add "CreateProject" to Crucible Project Service for REST/Plugin APIs

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Make sure you are not logged into Crucible (eg. your login session has expired)
2. On a JIRA Fisheye tab, click on "Create review for this changeset in XXX"
3. Crucible will prompt you to log in -- enter your details
4. Crucible will then present you with a window to "Select Project for New Review"

Expected behaviour:
Crucible will present you with a window with pre-filled-in values for author, moderator, project, etc.
fields.summary: Creating a review from JIRA when not logged into Crucible makes it forget the JIRA context
Searching does not return correct result

fields.description: Activity streams allow you to filter on file name, extension and comment, which aren't respected by the watches.  The watches should be rewritten to use the new activity search rather than the old infdb query search.
fields.summary: Watches don't use the same parameters as the activity stream

fields.description:
In FF and Saf, a test script to alert poll refreshes fires off every 20s as predicted, incrementing as it displays.

The same script in IE7 and IE8 continuously refreshes once the poll is initiated. The increment is fine, but the rate is extreme. 

I think its this continual redrawing of the details table that is causing the avatars to disappear at times when there's not enough time to retrieve the graphics. This should fix http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-2414

Obviously there will also be a massive page responsiveness boost if the processor can be freed from this loop. 

!http://img.skitch.com/20091124-txicqh372xmrj1hk45cw5beq1.png!
fields.summary: IE7 and 8 continuously fire off the poll ajax after it's first called
Merge repository changset indexes into one x-repo index
Remove imagemaps from SparkLines on users page

fields.description: I raised a defect on a line of code because some of the HTML attributes were not quoted consistently. The author thought I was crazy until we realized that the closing attribute quote changes sometimes by waving the mouse over the line or by clicking on the comment.
fields.summary: Sometimes quotes and double-quotes in code reviews are displayed incorrectly

fields.description:
I don't know why anyone would want to IGNORE the SIGNIFICANT whitespace but see the INSIGNIFICANT whitespace.

The three options that would make sense to me are:
* Don't Ignore Whitespace (shows all whitespace changes)
* Ignore Insignificant Whitespace (shows important whitespace changes inside of Strings, etc.; would be language dependent)
* Ignore All Whitespace (shows no whitespace changes)

Those three options would provide a meaningful progression from ignoring to not ignoring.
fields.summary: Option "Ignore Significant Whitespace" doesn't make sense

fields.description:
A customer Mark Mielke reported upgrades taking 4 hours. With some changes to queries to use temporary tables, and combining redundant queries into one he was able to cut the time down to 26 minutes. 

Patch is attached in {{upgrade_accelerator_patch.diff}}.
fields.summary: Performance improvements for SQL upgrade scripts.

fields.description:
Use Nic's [Dual Pane Diff|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~nvenegas/ShipIt+12+Shipment+Order+-+Better+Side-By-Side+Diff] ShipIt work as a starting point.

must work in all SPM browsers
fields.summary: Replace FishEye's side-by-side diff with Dual Pane side-by-side diff

fields.description: The Changeset detail page should paginate revisions for changesets containing more than N revisions. Try N = 20 initially.
fields.summary: Paginated changesets in FishEye

fields.description:
- click and drag is intercepted in much the same way we do in crucible
    -- lines dragged over are marked as "selected" using a background color change.
    -- try hard to preserve normal selection semantics for single line selections (i.e. only kick in after crossing a line boundary)
  - releasing the drag triggers a popup below the selection
    -- popup has "copy to clipboard" button and a checkbox "include line numbers"
      --- line number checkbox is sticky setting
fields.summary: FishEye annotation page: support copy & paste of code

fields.description:
- revision links in source have an on-hover RHS down-triangle
 - hovering over down-triangle inverts its colours (i.e. to show selection)
 - clicking on down-triangle produces popup

fields.description:
At present, QuickNav matches directory paths which contain the same set of path components, so the query a/b/c will match a/c/b a/x/c/y/z and so on. 
Each component is a prefix match, so a/b/c will also match boo/aha/cor. 
Each component may also do camel case matching, so a component AnB matches An*B*

We could make this behaviour more antglob like by:

1. ignoring components which are just * or **
2. Not doing prefix matches unless there is an explicit trailing *
3. Allowing leading and internal *s

fields.description:
From [Paul's comment|http://svn.atlassian.com/fisheye/cru/CR-INTERNAL-58#c2713]:

Priority...

# closed reviews are not being excluded from the various lists.
# if we see that the XML query to JIRA contains JQL then print out the JQL when listing the reviews that match the XML from JIRA.  This will help people understand what issues that are looking at the reviews for
# LOW -ideally we are able to detect issues that have subtasks and then look for reviews on subtasks.  if we find a review on a subtask we "soften" the warning about an issue being in the to be reviewed state and not having an associated review.-

Here's what {{wget}} says:

--2009-09-17 17:31:53--  https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-2026

WARNING: cannot verify jira.atlassian.com's certificate, issued by `/C=US/O=DigiCert Inc/OU=www.digicert.com/CN=DigiCert Global CA':

fields.description:
It looks like we're failing to export com.atlassian.event.* and com.atlassian.fisheye.event.* to plugins, causing plugins that use the event framework to fail on load:

{noformat}
Caused by: org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Unresolved constraint in bundle 33: package; (&(package=com.atlassian.event)(version>=0.5.0))
        at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix._resolveBundle(Felix.java:1725)
        at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix._startBundle(Felix.java:1588)
        at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.startBundle(Felix.java:1541)
        at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl.start(BundleImpl.java:371)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.factory.OsgiPlugin.enableInternal(OsgiPlugin.java:342)
        ... 101 more 
{noformat}

Adding "com.atlassian.event" to "packageScannerConfig.setPackageIncludes()", causes it to fail a little further into the process on:

{noformat}
Caused by: org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Unresolved constraint in bundle 33: package; (&(package=com.atlassian.fisheye.event)(version>=2.1.0.442))
	at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix._resolveBundle(Felix.java:1725)
	at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix._startBundle(Felix.java:1588)
	at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.startBundle(Felix.java:1541)
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl.start(BundleImpl.java:371)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.factory.OsgiPlugin.enableInternal(OsgiPlugin.java:342)
	... 99 more
{noformat}

I was unable to quickly fix this last one.

You can reproduce the problem by running fecru 2.1.0 standalone and then dumping the attached plugin into var/plugins/user
fields.summary: FisheyePluginManagerFactory does not export com.atlassian.event
